pullRequest.title: Enchantment Rune
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description

A new ancient rune called Enchantment Rune.
Changes

Added a new rune called Enchantment Rune.
Works similar to Soulbound Rune.
Added a new magical resource called Magical Glass.
Added a new recipe for Ancient Altar.
Added a new recipe for Magical Workbench.
Added new researches for new items.
Related Issues


N/A
Checklist



 I have fully tested the proposed changes and promise that they will not break everything into chaos.
 I have also tested the proposed changes in combination with various popular addons and can confirm my changes do not break them.
 I followed the existing code standards and didn't mess up the formatting.
 I did my best to add documentation to any public classes or methods I added.
 I added sufficient Unit Tests to cover my code.

commit.message:
Added Enchantment Rune.

Added Enchantment Rune that applies a random enchantment on items.
Works similar to Soulbound Rune.

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/LinoxGH/Slimefun4 into EnchRune

 Conflicts:
	src/main/java/io/github/thebusybiscuit/slimefun4/implementation/SlimefunItems.java
	src/main/java/io/github/thebusybiscuit/slimefun4/implementation/setup/ResearchSetup.java
	src/main/resources/languages/researches_en.yml

nodes.bodyText: This is a rather bad approach to this. It would be much better to loop through all Enchantments and split them based on the .canEnchant() method or so to sort it based on items.

I wouldn't really have a seperate research for this, these two can easily share the same research.
Besides... why glass anyway?

Please do not use abbreviations like this.
This is a nightmare maintenance-wise. Name your methods accordingly, like getApplicableEnchantments.
And not findEnchArr...
This can (and probably should) be done using a ternary operator.

Please write out your variable names...
Abbreviations make it hard to maintain later down the line.
This should be an EnumMap, not a HashMap.

All of this can be reduced to a single line:
getOrDefault
Why are you storing this as a variable here? I don't see this index used anywhere else.
Should probably choose a little more magical sound effect and visual than a quote: GENERIC_SPLODE...
Should also check for conflicts, since you wouldn't want to enchant a Silk Touch with Fortune.
Also always declare with base types, Map.
No need for the rather unncessary and expensive call with the ItemStack here, you can just use this here.
You could save yourself this Array to ArrayList conversion if you directly stored a List in your Map
You should use .isEmpty() here
This would result in concurrent modification. Use an Iterator instead.
Also you are missing conflicting enchantments

commit.message: Did the requested changes + a fix.

nodes.bodyText: This will remove it from the actual List stored inside your Map, so you should copy the List before modifying it in any way.

Hmmm, well you are returning anyway when the list is empty...
So you could just do a simple get and do a null check instead of creating a new ArrayList and then immediately discarding it.
Should probably also send a failure message if no enchantment was applicable.
Also still missing the conflict check.

You are creating two new ArrayLists here.
Please only use .get(), do a null check and then copy. Otherwise you are just creating a wasteful List, which you then copy and then discard both. This is really inefficient.
